abstract.text: The root object of an Apple News article, that contains required properties, metadata, content, layout, and styles.

inlineContent.text: An array of components that form the content of this article. Components have different roles and types, such as
The component text styles that components in this document can refer to. Each
file must have, at minimum, a default component text style named
. You can also set defaults by component role. See
A unique, publisher-provided identifier for this article. This identifier must remain constant; you canâ€™t change it when you update the article. See
This identifier can include the following:
A code that indicates the language of the article. Use the
to find the appropriate code; e.g.,
for English, or the more specific

The articleâ€™s column system. Apple News Format layouts make it possible to recreate print design on iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple Vision Pro. Apple News Format uses the layout information to calculate relative positioning and size for these devices. See
The article title or headline. Use plain text; formatted text (HTML or Markdown) isnâ€™t supported.
The version of Apple News Format you use in the JSON document.
property must not be earlier than the version number of any property that you use anywhere in the article.
An advertisement to be inserted at a position that is both possible and optimal. You can specify what
you want to have automatically inserted.
Note. This property is deprecated. Use the
The metadata, appearance, and placement of advertising and related content components within Apple News Format articles.
object that you use for automatic Dark Mode behavior.
objects that you can refer to by their key within the
The component styles that you can refer to by components within this document. See
An object containing the background color of the article.
The articleâ€™s metadata, such as publication date, ad campaign data, and other information that isnâ€™t part of the core article content.
The article subtitle. Should be plain text; formatted text (HTML or Markdown) isnâ€™t supported.

objects defaults to the value of this property.

Every Apple News Format document must have the same filename:
object. This is the object that is sent in
Every Apple News Format document must contain all items marked as required in the preceding Properties list. Apple News API and
display errors if you omit any required properties. See
In JSON, the order of properties in an object is not important; however, as you create your JSON document, you may find it useful to follow the order shown in the example that follows.
To view this example in News Preview, copy the example code to a file named
in the same folder. (You can use any JPEG, GIF, or PNG file.)

code: "text": "The Apple News Format allows publishers to craft beautiful editorial layouts. Galleries, audio, video, and fun interactions like animation make stories spring to life."

abstract.text: Learn the basics for adding components to your article.
Learn how Apple News Format versions map to iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and visionOS releases.
Change the information that News displays about your published article.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Changing the Appearance of Your Article Tile in Feeds

abstract.text: Plan the design for your article and create it in Apple News Format.
Define and apply custom, default, and inline text styles, or use HTML tags or Markdown syntax to style your text.
Improve the appearance of the text and components in your article by using Apple News Format styles.
Understand basic JSON concepts and become familiar with the structure of an Apple News Format article.
Define a layout that supports the look you want for your article.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Planning the Layout for Your Article

abstract.text: Align article components with columns in your layout.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Positioning the Content in Your Article

abstract.text: Use HTML formatting for text components.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Using HTML with Apple News Format

abstract.text: Use Markdown formatting for text components.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Using Markdown with Apple News Format

abstract.text: Update an existing article in your channel.
Publish an article to your channel.
Get Apple News Format reference information, and create signature content for Apple News.
The object for defining the automatic placement of advertisements.
The object for defining properties that affect the frequency and placement with which banner advertisements and medium rectangle advertisements are automatically placed in your article.
The root object of an Apple News article, that contains required properties, metadata, content, layout, and styles.
The object that contains information about the color scheme of the document, including Dark Mode behavior.
An object containing component layout objects that components in the article can refer to.
An object containing component style objects that components in the article can refer to.
An object containing component text style defaults as well as component text styles that components in the article can use.
An object containing text style objects that components within this document can refer to inline in text.
The object for automatically placing components within Apple News Format articles.
Properties shared by all component types.
The object for setting the background color for your article.
The object for specifying formatted text content and styling for captions in table cells.
The object for applying text styling when not using HTML or Markdown formatting.
The object for defining columns, gutters, and margins for your articleâ€™s designed width.
Information about your article, including author name, creation date, publication date, keywords, and excerpt.
The component for adding a playable music file.
The component for including a photograph.
The identifier provided by the publisher.
Properties shared by all text component types.
